etymology.description: Pictogram — valley (口) between two mountain walls shown as near-parallel lines; original form 𠔌.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts a valley opening between two slopes, with the central opening like a mouth. The earlier form 𠔌 makes the two walls and the gap more explicit, later stylized into the current graph.

examples.chinese: 我们在山谷里露营(我們在山谷裡露營)。
这条河穿过狭窄的谷地(這條河穿過狹窄的谷地)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè tiáo hé chuānguò xiázhǎi de gǔdì.
examples.english: This river passes through a narrow valley.

examples.chinese: 回声在谷中回荡(回聲在谷中回盪)。
